channel.title: Indalit Cloud Consulting
channel.description: Recent content on Indalit Cloud Consulting

item.title: Debugging www.indalit.com
item.description: On my previous post I was working on www.indalit.com. First of all, I, innocent me, actually thought I was finished. But then, I made the mistake at looking at the page with my mobile phone!!! And then making my browser screen smaller!!! Wow, horrible. So, it turns out working with CSS and positioning correctly DIVs is just not a beginners thing. Took me hours of work. Now it works great, but my associate has decided it needs to be centered.

item.title: Bug Report - Hugo - Universal Theme - in BLOG Image Loading Intermittent
item.description: Environment Hugo Static Website Generator version v0.36 Hugo Universal Theme Hosted on AWS S3 in http only Image size as per examples : 1000 x 750 .js and .css files have not been modified What should be happening When going on the BLOG page, a list of most recent blog post will appear one after the other with the associated image on the left. What is happening When going on the BLOG page, a list of most recent blog post will appear one after the other with or without the image on the left.

item.title: AWS VPC To Span Across AZs
item.description: Did you know that a subnet cannot span multiple AWS Availability Zones while a VPC can? For more information on AWS VPC Configuration see: http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonVPC/latest/UserGuide/VPC_Subnets.html

item.title: Creating the Packs Web Page
item.description: As you probably don't know, I am creating/making/writing/configuring www.indalit.com using an open source static site generator called Hugo. I've chosen a theme and moved forward from that. The small glitch is I'm am NOT a web developer at all. I've learned Python for fun and mostly forgot since I haven't been practicing, but that's all my experience in the development world. So working on this site has been a great challenge for me; Hugo provides a theme, but that's just the base and after that you have a lot of modifications to do.

item.title: AWS Storage Gateway Cheat Sheet
item.description: General Characteristics 3 types of gateways available(NFS or iSCSI): - File Gateway - Volume Gateway - Tape Gateway You install the Gateways with a provided image on a on-premises server VM. Also possible on an instance. VM software is either VMware ESXi or Microsoft Hyper-V. Objects on S3 are encrypted using S3 SSE-S3 (S3 managed encryption keys).

item.title: AWS Has Launched a New General Purpose Instance Family, M5
item.description: Did you know AWS EC2 has a new General Purpose instance family, M5? Check if available in your region. For more information on Amazon Web Services General Purpose Instance Family M5 see: https://aws.amazon.com/about-aws/whats-new/2017/11/introducing-amazon-ec2-m5-instances/

item.title: AWS Launches Amazon GuardDuty
item.description: Did you know AWS launched Amazon GuardDuty? This is a threat detection service which analyses events from AWS CloudTrail, VPC Flow Logs and more. For more information on Amazon Web Services GuardDuty see: https://aws.amazon.com/about-aws/whats-new/2017/11/announcing-amazon-guardduty-intelligent-threat-detection/

item.title: A Sort of Personal Blog
item.description: Yes, it’s official, we are starting the process of creating our company. I assume this will take a few months, but I am not in a hurry. At this stage roles are not clear, so I go with the flow. For now, I seem responsible for the design/creation and configuration of our website Indalit.com and it’s content. So, I decided on having a blog. Inicially thinking it will look professional, be a good place to publish what I write about AWS and help with SEO.

item.title: AWS EC2 EBS Encryption of Boot Volume
item.description: Did you know the Amazon Elastic Block Store (EBS) boot volume can be encrypted?

item.title: AWS S3 Encryption SSE-C
item.description: Did you know Amazon S3 SSE-C means Server Side Encryption with Customer-Provided Keys? For more information on Amazon S3 Encryption see: https://aws.amazon.com/s3/faqs/

item.title: AWS Deleting the Queue After 30 Days
item.description: Did you know if an #AWS #SQS queue does not receive certain requests for more than 30 days, AWS reserves the right to delete the queue? For more information on Amazon Web Services SQS Queues and what AWS can do with them see: https://cloudacademy.com/quiz/study/411880/

item.title: AWS RDS Multi Availability Zone Deployment
item.description: Did you know with an Amazone RDS Multi-AZ deployment, the standby cannot be used for read or write operations?

item.title: AWS EC2 Ephemeral Storage
item.description: Did you know when an Amazon EC2 instance with ephemeral store volumes is stopped, the data is lost?

item.title: AWS RDS Database Read Replicas
item.description: Did you know that with Amazon RDS you can create Read Replicas from an another Read Replica and have the replication handled between them? This reduces the load on the master.

item.title: AWS EC2 Instances T2 VPC
item.description: Did you know you cannot launch an AWS T2 instance type in an EC2-Classic platform? You must launch it in a VPC. For more information on Amazon EC2 T2 instance family type see: http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/t2-instances.html

item.title: AWS Glacier Expedite
item.description: Did you know there is an option to expedite the retrieval of an Amazon Glacier archive within minutes? For more information on Amazon Glacier Expedite Option see: http://docs.aws.amazon.com/amazonglacier/latest/dev/downloading-an-archive-two-steps.html

item.title: AWS EC2 Instances Public IP
item.description: Did you know an Amazon EC2 instance retains its private IP addresses when it is stopped? This is not the case for the public IP address which is released when the instance is stopped. For more information on Amazon EC2 Instances IP addressing see: http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/Stop_Start.html

item.title: AWS EC2 Intances Metadata
item.description: Did you know that viewing on an AWS instance http://169.254.169.254/latest/meta-data/ will give you the metadata of your instance? For more information on AWS EC2 Instances see: http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/ec2-instance-metadata.html

item.title: AWS Glacier Minimum Pricing
item.description: Did you know if you delete an archive from Amazon Glacier less than 90 days after it was uploaded you will still pay 90 days of storage for it? For more information on Amazon Glacier pricing see: https://aws.amazon.com/glacier/pricing/

item.title: AWS Auto Scaling Cooldown Period
item.description: Did you know the default AWS Auto Scaling cooldown period is 300 seconds? When AWS Auto Scaling launches a new instance, it will wait 300 seconds before launching a new one.

item.title: AWS Auto Scaling Termination Policy
item.description: Did you know when you use the default termination policy with AWS Auto Scaling it doesn’t terminate the instance with the oldest launch configuration automatically? It first tries to balance the number of instances across Availability Zones, then picks the Availability Zone with the most instances and terminates the instance with the oldest launch configuration. If there are more than one, then it ends the process by randomly picking the instance to terminate.

item.title: AWS
item.description: Friends don't let friends build datacenters -- Charles E. Philips Amazon Web Services is the most known and powerful Cloud platform around, and you know that with great power comes great responsibilities! There are many ways of designing an AWS infrastructure, from the simplest to the unnecessarily complicated. Our mission: to fit your needs. AWS is composed of hundreds of services that can be plugged together, leading to thousands of possible combinations!

item.title: Contact
item.description: We are here to help you Are you curious about something? Do you need more information about our company , our services and packs. Or maybe you are in need of professional expertise in AWS Cloud Technologies or the DevOps realm. Then don’t hesitate, we are here to help. Please feel free to contact us, we are opened from 9AM to 12PM and 2PM to 6PM. +34 699 184 246

item.title: DevOps
item.description: UNIX is not so much an operating system as a way of thinking! What is DevOps? Long story short, DevOps means R.O.I., the days of the mutable infrastructure are gone. With cloud infrastructure and moreover ephemeral instances, immutable platforms are the new norm. Get ready to put aside chaos and enter the world of predictivity. Yet, continuous integration is not as easy as a git pull, there must be strategy, knowledge and control.

item.title: PACKS
item.description: Discover Our Packs AWS Presentation Pack Need to quickly understand AWS, it's most important services and the pricing? An introductory presentation is what you need. Given by a certified Solutions Architect who can guide you and answer your questions. Online video conferencing 2 to 4 hours depending on your need 1 pre-defined topic can be added Questions and Answers at the end Slides provided 1 hour follow-up call €239 AWS Training Pack Test Need all the theory about a specific AWS service?
